issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.summary: Instance restore of image fails due to incorrect machine image identifier

comments.body:
Ok, at first glance, the image id information is only being set on CC upon reception of the RunInstance message. From the CC perspective (later confirmed by looking at the xml on wire), the CLC is not reporting a lot of the expected field information to the CC within the RunInstance context but its part of the VBR subtags:

*CC Logs*
{noformat}
2014-04-23 15:58:37 DEBUG 000031685 doRunInstances           | invoked: userId=AID0I0GKIN86ON61DQKWM, emiId=UNSET, kernelId=UNSET, ramdiskId=UNSET, emiURL=UNSET, kernelURL=UNSET, ramdiskURL=UNSET, instIdsLen=1, netNamesLen=1, macAddrsLen=1, networkIndexListLen=1, minCount=1, maxCount=1, accountId=966616386005, ownerId=AID0I0GKIN86ON61DQKWM, reservationId=r-087f5739, keyName=, vlan=633, userData=, credential=, launchIndex=0, platform=linux, targetNode=UNSET
{noformat}

*XML Message*
{code}
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='utf-8'?>
<Envelope xmlns="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/">
	<Body xmlns:wsu="http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-wssecurity-utility-1.0.xsd" wsu:Id="id-276DFF646E6DE6E578139829391761976016">

			</services>
			<services>

			</services>
			<services>

			</services>
			<services>
				<partition>eucalyptus</partition>
				<type>eucalyptus</type>
				<name>10.111.1.116</name>
				<uris>http://10.111.1.116:8773/services/Eucalyptus</uris>
			</services>
			<services>
				<partition>PARTI00</partition>
				<type>storage</type>
				<name>SC_135</name>
				<uris>http://10.111.1.135:8773/services/Storage</uris>
			</services>
			<services>
				<partition>walrus</partition>
				<type>walrusbackend</type>
				<name>WS_116</name>
				<uris>http://10.111.1.116:8773/services/WalrusBackend</uris>
			</services>
			<services>

				</virtualBootRecord>

					<guestDeviceName>sda</guestDeviceName>
					<size>2147483648</size>
					<format>none</format>
					<id>emi-2a66ac4a</id>
					<type>machine</type>
				</virtualBootRecord>
			</instanceType>
			<keyName />
			<maxCount>1</maxCount>
			<minCount>1</minCount>
			<reservationId>r-087f5739</reservationId>
			<instanceIds>i-0cb482b2</instanceIds>
			<netNames>966616386005-8a77eec3-4ea9-465e-a397-5c8ec6f31ccb</netNames>
			<macAddresses />
			<networkIndexList>10</networkIndexList>
			<uuids>bb1868a3-6d57-4409-8d8c-94bff584c946</uuids>
			<vlan>633</vlan>
			<userData />
			<credential />
			<launchIndex>0</launchIndex>
			<platform>linux</platform>
			<ownerId>AID0I0GKIN86ON61DQKWM</ownerId>
			<accountId>966616386005</accountId>
		</RunInstances>
	</Body>
</Envelope>
{code}

Still digging.

Looking at the describe instance answer on the wire, I can see that CC provides empty sets for image id and others. I also do not see any disk information being passed up?!?

{code}
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='utf-8'?>
<soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/">
	<soapenv:Body xmlns:wsu="http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-wssecurity-utility-1.0.xsd" wsu:Id="SigID-fddb6ac4-cb3c-1e31-2fce">
		<n:DescribeInstancesResponse xmlns:n="http://eucalyptus.ucsb.edu/">
			<n:correlationId>null-183435</n:correlationId>
			<n:userId>eucalyptus</n:userId>
			<n:return>true</n:return>
			<n:instances>
				<n:uuid>bb1868a3-6d57-4409-8d8c-94bff584c946</n:uuid>
				<n:imageId></n:imageId>
				<n:kernelId></n:kernelId>
				<n:ramdiskId></n:ramdiskId>
				<n:instanceId>i-0cb482b2</n:instanceId>
				<n:instanceType>
					<n:name>m1.small</n:name>
					<n:memory>256</n:memory>
					<n:cores>1</n:cores>
					<n:disk>5</n:disk>
					<n:virtualBootRecord>
						<n:resourceLocation>none</n:resourceLocation>
						<n:guestDeviceName>sdb</n:guestDeviceName>
						<n:size>3221225472</n:size>
						<n:format>ext3</n:format>
						<n:id>none</n:id>
						<n:type>ephemeral</n:type>
					</n:virtualBootRecord>
					<n:virtualBootRecord>
						<n:resourceLocation>http://imaging@10.111.1.116:8773/services/objectstorage/10a68f-download-manifests/DM-r-087f5739?Expires=1398304712&AWSAccessKeyId=AKIIKPUQFOAWWLJ56DDK&Signature=wZn%2FaZ9d%2FhRsg539Ji5e3%2FyTjAg%3D
						</n:resourceLocation>
						<n:guestDeviceName>sda</n:guestDeviceName>
						<n:size>2147483648</n:size>
						<n:format>none</n:format>
						<n:id>emi-2a66ac4a</n:id>
						<n:type>machine</n:type>
					</n:virtualBootRecord>
				</n:instanceType>
				<n:keyName></n:keyName>
				<n:launchTime>2014-04-23T22:58:37.873Z</n:launchTime>
				<n:stateName>Extant</n:stateName>
				<n:netParams>
					<n:privateMacAddress>D0:0D:0C:B4:82:B2</n:privateMacAddress>
					<n:privateIp>1.112.39.122</n:privateIp>
					<n:publicIp>10.111.101.51</n:publicIp>
					<n:vlan>633</n:vlan>
					<n:networkIndex>10</n:networkIndex>
				</n:netParams>
				<n:ownerId>AID0I0GKIN86ON61DQKWM</n:ownerId>
				<n:accountId>966616386005</n:accountId>
				<n:reservationId>r-087f5739</n:reservationId>
				<n:serviceTag>http://10.111.5.56:8775/axis2/services/EucalyptusNC
				</n:serviceTag>
				<n:userData></n:userData>
				<n:launchIndex>0</n:launchIndex>
				<n:platform>linux</n:platform>
				<n:bundleTaskStateName>none</n:bundleTaskStateName>
				<n:blkbytes>0</n:blkbytes>
				<n:netbytes>0</n:netbytes>
				<n:guestStateName>poweredOn</n:guestStateName>
				<n:migrationStateName>none</n:migrationStateName>
				<n:groupNames>966616386005-8a77eec3-4ea9-465e-a397-5c8ec6f31ccb
				</n:groupNames>
			</n:instances>
		</n:DescribeInstancesResponse>
	</soapenv:Body>
</soapenv:Envelope>
{code}

[~sjones], do you have some steps to reproduce this or know of some. I tried with different images (hvm, EBS) and cannot duplicate the problem. I check the information returned by both CC (previous comment) and NC (below) for DescribeInstances and both do not fill this field in my cases even when I try to create an orphan instance and look at the CLC rebuilding it. Would help me if I know how to reproduce.

Describe Instance from NC
{code}
<soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/">
	<soapenv:Body
		xmlns:wsu="http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-wssecurity-utility-1.0.xsd"
		wsu:Id="SigID-88a47cb0-cbfe-1e31-2190">
		<n:ncDescribeInstancesResponse xmlns:n="http://eucalyptus.ucsb.edu/">
			<n:userId>eucalyptus</n:userId>
			<n:return>true</n:return>

				<n:uuid>bc6828ea-fb1f-4d9a-b3a2-8c50aa7bee1d</n:uuid>

					966616386005@eucalyptus.chuck</n:keyName>

					<n:name>m1.small</n:name>
					<n:memory>256</n:memory>
					<n:cores>1</n:cores>
					<n:disk>5</n:disk>
					<n:virtualBootRecord>
						<n:resourceLocation>sc://vol-386f219a,
						</n:resourceLocation>
						<n:guestDeviceName>sdc</n:guestDeviceName>
						<n:size>2147483648</n:size>
						<n:format>none</n:format>
						<n:id>emi-f3da10ca</n:id>
						<n:type>ebs</n:type>
					</n:virtualBootRecord>
				</n:instanceType>
				<n:netParams>
					<n:privateMacAddress>D0:0D:A6:8E:53:46</n:privateMacAddress>
					<n:privateIp>1.112.35.73</n:privateIp>
					<n:publicIp>10.111.101.51</n:publicIp>
					<n:vlan>566</n:vlan>
					<n:networkIndex>9</n:networkIndex>
				</n:netParams>
				<n:stateName>Extant</n:stateName>
				<n:bundleTaskStateName>none</n:bundleTaskStateName>
				<n:createImageStateName></n:createImageStateName>
				<n:launchTime>2014-04-24T22:14:37.585Z</n:launchTime>
				<n:blkbytes>0</n:blkbytes>
				<n:netbytes>0</n:netbytes>
				<n:guestStateName>poweredOn</n:guestStateName>
				<n:migrationStateName>none</n:migrationStateName>

				<n:platform>linux</n:platform>
				<n:groupNames>966616386005-6b0ba0e6-b9d7-4aad-b48a-34a1eb782873
				</n:groupNames>
			</n:instances>
		</n:ncDescribeInstancesResponse>
	</soapenv:Body>
</soapenv:Envelope>
{code}

Thanks a lot [~sjones]. 

I have not had a chance to try paravirtualized instance yet since there's a bug existing preventing these instance to run according to [~mclark] and I confirmed I can't get them to run...

I have started up a paravirtual instance with the latest code and I am not seeing any {{dsk-*}} identifiers on the wire. All IDs reported in DescribeInstances (enclosed by <n:id>...</n:id> tags) are:

* none
* emi-...
* eki-...
* eri-...

It is quite plausible that recent changes to how paravirt images (partition images) get deployed changed the content of VBRs reported in DescribeInstancesReply. So, I am going to close this as 'Cannot Reproduce'. Please, do re-open if the problem is still present. Thank you!
